author: Lorrie Reyes
title: Saugus football leaves no doubts
text:
Saugus football leaves no doubts Cents score 21 early points, run away from Cats Posted: October 9, 2015 11:30   9, 2015 11:30 p.m. Saugus running back Jonathan Cordova (23) heads for the end zone as West Ranch cornerback Hunter Anderson knocks him out of bounds at College of the Canyons on Friday night. Signal photo by Dan Watson. A A A 
It was all in the execution. 
Saugus came out and scored on three of its first four possessions in a 42-7 win over West Ranch on Friday night at College of the Canyons. 
The Centurions led 21-0 before the first quarter ticked all the way down. 
“We executed really well (on offense) and our defense shut them down,” said Saugus quarterback Louis Eusebi. “Our defense has been playing lights out and our offense finally picked it up.” 
The Cents offense was efficient. On their first drive of the game they ran eight plays (six runs, two passes) and drove 50 yards in just over 2 minutes. 
Jon Cordova, David Aubrey and Amir Bishop all touched the ball in the running game, with Bishop capping the drive with a 2-yard touchdown. 
Eusebi helped himself out on the ground, rushing for 50 yards on fourth-and-2 for the second score of the night. 
Cordova scored twice on the ground, once from a yard out and again from 2 yards out. 
Aubrey added a rushing TD from 1 yard out in the third quarter. 
On defense, the Centurions were able to slow down the high-octane offense of the Wildcats. 
Saugus put pressure on West Ranch early and often. 
Wildcats’ quarterback Jackson Clark had to be removed from the game with 22 seconds left in the first quarter after being sacked for the third time of the night. 
“We just didn’t execute,” said West Ranch head coach Jan Miller. “Our offense has to execute. When the offense doesn’t execute then this is what happens. For some reason our quarterbacks were just holding on to the ball tonight. We’ll look at the film and see what’s going on, but they’re just holding onto the ball forever.” 
The only points the Wildcats were able to get on the board were from backup signal caller Wyatt Eget, who threw a 76-yard pass to Jordan Hunt in the third quarter. 
Saugus (3-3 overall, 1-0 Foothill League) plays Valencia next Friday, while West Ranch (3-3, 0-1) faces Hart.
